image.altText: A spectacular view of Sydney Harbour shows the Opera House and Harbour Bridge illuminated by golden fireworks.

props.synopsis: After many hours of preparation (and days of camping out, for some), thousands take part in festivities around the country.

title.children: Thousands gather for New Year's Eve fireworks at events across Australia

image.altText: A back and white photo of Eric Jacobi.

props.synopsis: Eric Stanley Jacobi was sentenced to death for murder, but he escaped the hangman thanks to a secret medical report that was hidden from the public for 75 years.

title.children: He committed a savage murder, but for reasons kept secret for 75 years Eric Jacobi was spared from execution

image.altText: A woman in a headscarf carries bags through the rubble of a destroyed building

props.synopsis: Since October 7, fear abounds among both Israelis and Palestinians. Now there are two major questions being discussed in Israel, writes John Lyons.

title.children: The two major questions being discussed in Israel as the Gaza war rages on

image.altText: Denmark royals arrive outside sandstone building, smiling

props.synopsis: Denmark's Queen Margrethe II, Europe's longest-serving monarch, will abdicate on January 14 after 52 years on the throne and will be succeeded by her eldest son Crown Prince Frederik, she announced on Sunday.

title.children: Denmark's Queen Margrethe II announces surprise abdication, succeeded by Frederik

image.altText: A black and white bride and groom photo with the couple ecstatically laughing

props.synopsis: Professional cyclist Rohan Dennis has been charged with causing the death of his wife, Olympian Melissa Hoskins after a crash in Adelaide's north on Saturday night.

title.children: Husband charged over crash that killed Olympian wife Melissa Hoskins in Adelaide

image.altText: A wave with blue luminescent light rolling into the shore.

props.synopsis: A night-time spectacle in waters off the New South Wales mid north coast and Sydney delights many this Christmas-New Year holiday period.

title.children: Missed the fireworks? Bioluminescence along NSW beaches is 'even better' and it's happening now

image.altText: Man in suit, with bald head, thick eyebrows and mustache

props.synopsis: Angelo Giulio "Diego" Bernacchi's vision for Maria Island is still visible today, almost 140 years after the Italian migrant arrived in Tasmania and looked set for success.

title.children: 'King Diego' built a business empire from wine and silk on Maria Island. Then it all crumbled

image.altText: Junior the maltese shi tzu waits patiently at owner Pete Richard's feet

props.synopsis: Pete didn't have any photos of Muffy and Junior the Maltese Shi Tzus, so he decided learn how to use his phone camera to take them himself.

title.children: Through a photo with his dogs, Pete is learning digital skills for the first time. And he's not alone

image.altText: A close up of a middle-aged white woman with straight hair to her chin speaking at a microphoned lecturn. A man behind her

props.synopsis: Shenna Bellows says she has no doubts the incident stemmed from her decision to remove Mr Trump from the state of Maine's presidential primary ballot.

title.children: US state official who removed Donald Trump from ballot targeted in 'swatting' call

image.altText: A home stands destroyed on a hill top.

props.synopsis: Tensions in one storm-impacted community bubble over as Queensland's Deputy Premier is ambushed by angry residents.

title.children: Frustrated residents face 10 days without power, while forecast severe weather could slow restoration further

image.altText: An ambulance travels on a road near a packed park in the afternoon.

props.synopsis: The boy and the girl were taken under lights and sirens to Perth Children's Hospital in a critical condition, but were unable to be saved.

title.children: Two children under 10 dead after being pulled from Perth's Swan River on New Year's Eve

image.altText: Flash flooding at Sapphire Beach in the Coffs Harbour area

props.synopsis: It is a wet end to the year on the NSW Coffs Coast, with floodwater inundating car parks and apartment buildings, and a New Year's Eve event being cancelled.

title.children: Floodwater inundates car parks and apartment buildings as slow-moving rain drenches Coffs Coast

image.altText: A prop car in a forest

props.synopsis: Thousands of tickets have already been sold for an outdoor Harry Potter event at a nature park south of Melbourne, which residents fear will pose a danger to local wildlife.

title.children: Council defends 'Forbidden Forest' Harry Potter experience after thousands sign petition to move event

image.altText: Two police walk in front of cargo pile up with fire fighter in the background closer to the wreckage

props.synopsis: Police say two train workers have died and the Barrier Highway is closed in both directions after a crash between a train and truck in Bindarrah.

title.children: Two train workers dead after crash between train and truck, near NSW and SA border

image.altText: Side photo of Queensland police car.

props.synopsis: A QAS spokesperson said emergency services performed CPR, but the child was in a critical condition and could not be revived.

title.children: Two-year-old girl dies after being found unconscious in hot car at Eungella, west of Mackay

image.altText: A close-up view of Maersk shipping containers.

props.synopsis: Global shipping company Maersk says it will pause all sailing through the Red Sea for 48 hours in response to the attack.

title.children: US Navy helicopters repel Houthi attack on container ship in Red Sea

image.altText: Rafael Nadal rests his chin on his palm as he takes questions at a press conference in Brisbane

props.synopsis: Rafael Nadal says he will not put a timeline on his retirement from tennis. It may come in 2024 but it could have been much sooner after his long lay-off following a hip injury.

title.children: 'I thought about retirement': Rafael Nadal opens up about long road back after major hip surgery

image.altText: A photo of a middle-aged man standing outdoors in the sun near a damaged building.

props.synopsis: Pilger's family announced his death on social media, saying his "journalism and documentaries were celebrated around the world".

title.children: Veteran Australian journalist and documentary-maker John Pilger dies aged 84

image.altText: A close up of North Korean leader Kim Jong Un giving a speech.

props.synopsis: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un sets economic, military and foreign policy goals for the coming year, lashing out at the US and vowing to launch new spy satellites, build military drones, and boost its nuclear arsenal.

title.children: North Korea warns to expect more nuclear weapons and war 'at any time' in 2024

image.altText: An elephant emerging from dense trees.

props.synopsis: When the elephants came, Kamal Rai ran for his life, but he slipped and fell. When he came to, he grabbed something nearby — not realising he'd wrapped his arms around a trunk.

title.children: 'The elephant started to spin his trunk': The farmers living side-by-side with herds of ravenous elephants

image.altText: A close up of a smiling Paula Abdul at a red carpet event

props.synopsis: Lythgoe has denied the allegations in a lawsuit days before a deadline for California's Sexual Abuse and Cover-Up Accountability Act.

title.children: American Idol's Paula Abdul sues former co-star Nigel Lythgoe for alleged sexual assault

image.altText: Ange Postecoglou

props.synopsis: Ange Postecoglou's Spurs have brushed aside an in-form Bournemouth side to close in on the Premier League lead while north London rivals Arsenal crashed to an unexpected defeat.

title.children: Spurs edge within three points of Premier League summit following latest win

image.altText: An old Anovlar pill box.

props.synopsis: The culmination of birth control content on social media gives the distinct impression that young women today are well and truly fed up with the pill. In Australia, however, the research suggests a different reality.

title.children: It liberated your mother and grandmother, but has the pill become a burden?

image.altText: a few cars seen damaged and on fire with billowing smoke

props.synopsis: Russia launches a fresh bombardment of Ukrainian cities, soon after Russian officials accused Ukraine of carrying out shelling on the Russian border city of Belgorod.

title.children: Russia launches fresh air assault on Ukraine after shelling of Belgorod kills 22

image.altText: A woman smiles and wears a tshirt saying Best Day Ever at a community event.

props.synopsis: The Christmas and New Year period can be one of the loneliest and emotionally complicated times of the year. Here's how some people are reaching out to connect with each other.

title.children: Lee was at her lowest point when her friends came to the rescue. Now she's paying it forward

image.altText: Karen Armanasco stands behind a counter laden with medications and over-the-counter pharmacy products.

props.synopsis: Prescriptions may be subsidised but the cost of over-the-counter pharmacy products is adding up for the chronically ill.

title.children: Having cancer has cost Karen more than $10,000 and the monthly pharmacy bills keep adding up

image.altText: A darts player smiles after a victory

props.synopsis: Luke Littler powers through to the quarter finals of the World Darts Championship, with the 16-year old defeating a former five-time world champion more than four decades his senior.

title.children: 'Unbelievable': The 16-year old sensation taking the darts world by storm

image.altText: Three women wearing white t-shirts hold placards while emotional

props.synopsis: With nowhere to turn domestically, families of victims killed in the Philippines' bloody war on drugs hope the International Criminal Court investigation will bring justice.

title.children: Philippines drug war victims look to ICC for justice as killings continue under Marcos Jr

image.altText: Mick Duke and his wife Joanne sitting down in an eating area, he has his arm around her. She died after a car crash in 2019

props.synopsis: After a dip in the number of road toll deaths during the pandemic, 2023 has seen a sudden spike in deaths in NSW, Victoria and South Australia.

title.children: 'My world fell apart': More than 5,800 people have been killed on Australian roads in past five years

image.altText: A Roman mosaic showing two men in robes standing next to a table bearing plant decorations, with the inscription 'Ianuarius'.

props.synopsis: Making a promise to the gods was once seen as the way to secure a happy new year. Now, resolutions revolve around self-improvement, which may make them all the harder to keep.

title.children: From ancient rituals to self-improvement: How new year's resolutions have changed over 4,000 years
